body: Updating examples, type annotations, and internal usages to make sure we're not using deprecated stuff.

comment_data.body: Using `11` here since that was the API version when https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/23670 was merged, which was the PR that deprecated these functions.

comment_regular_data.body:
@lewis6991 while working on this I noticed that some deprecated functions in `_meta/` are documented yet don't have a `@deprecated` tag (example [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/cfb898cd8a42ff2262c96a12919a3cacef9d2973/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/api.lua#L431)). I originally tried adding the deprecation annotation but `docgen` removed it. Is that intended or is this another instance of the doc generator bullying me?

EDIT: I suspect this is happening because the functions I'm trying to `@deprecate` are also keys in `dispatch_deprecated` 🤔? @justinmk do you have any context about this (since you modified it 7 years ago lol)?

> I suspect this is happening because the functions I'm trying to `@deprecate` are also keys in `dispatch_deprecated` 🤔?

which functions? i don't see `nvim_get_hl_by_name` nor `nvim_get_option_info` in there.

in any case, `dispatch_deprecated` IIRC is for renames. could update it if needed

> which functions? i don't see nvim_get_hl_by_name nor nvim_get_option_info in there.

@justinmk I'm referring to the functions in the `api.lua` diff (like `vim.api.nvim_buf_get_option` and `vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option`). These are listed in `deprecated.txt` and have been announced in `news.txt` as such, yet their types in `_meta` don't have a `@deprecated` tag and when adding it `docgen` wants to remove it.

title: docs: do not use deprecated functions
